summary: Versatile and experienced professional with a demonstrated history of working in the international culture and media sectors, as a (creative) producer, artistic director and/or manager of a film company, a strand of tv-documentaries, several performance arts festivals in five different countries, and an architecture biennale, among others; as a curator of exhibitions in São Paulo, Porto, Istanbul, Dordrecht and Rotterdam, among others; as an advisor to the EU, de Dutch and Albanian governments and the cities of Amsterdam and Rotterdam, among others; and as a maker of films, a photographer, and a writer of books and scripts. And last but not least, deeply concerned about the climate crisis and the loss of biodiversity, also as an activist: we are way in over our heads and there is no sensible alternative to Extinction Rebellion.

[{'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'XToGo BV', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2003}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2003}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'XToGo BV', 'description': 'Since the fall of 2021, when I left the IABR after having directed it since 2003, and liquidated Amago BV and brought the ongoing projects into XToGo BV, my focus is back on writing and film development, still and always with an eye to how we can cope with climate crisis and ongoing mass extinction.
My new book, Down to Earth, Designing for the Endgame, will be published later in 2023. This book about designing in times of climate crisis is the final project of DOWN TO EARTH, the antitypical 9th edition of the International Architecture Biennale Rotterdam, that I curated. In a world in lockdown, I turned the traditional biennale model inside out and focused on unfolding the research by design of the IABR–Ateliers: explorations into ways to use the energy transition and water challenge as leverage to find concrete solutions to pressing socio-civic issues and help stave off some of the impact of the climate crisis. The publisher, nai010, recommends it as a "a tour de force: it is history, report and imagination of as well as reflection on contemporary design in times of climate crisis." Since 2003 Amago has branched out into content development, consultancy and creative production in the fields of design and architecture as well as film, and with a focus on projects that combine a cultural approach and spatial design with applied research into how to find solutions for the consequences of climate change, bio diversity loss, inequality and poverty - mostly projects that converge on the overlap of urbanization and climate crisis, with a focus on the the water-food-energy nexus. As such I have been managing and/or was actively involved in projects in The Netherlands, in Belgium, Albania, India (Chennai), Indonesia (Semarang), Singapore, Bangladesh (Khulna), Brazil (São Paulo)
